title: D emography A useful general introduction to the notion of life cycles is Harlow and Laurence 2002. Some of the fullest data for understanding life cycles, demographic parameters and the role of gender can be found in Roman Egypt
On the controversial topic of infanticide, the range of views, ancient sources and a full bibliography can be found in Bagnall and Frier

note: and the more basic introduction to Greek houses by J. Morgan
title: On the use of space in the ancient word generally see M
On domestic houses in the Greek and Roman worlds good starting points are the recent survey 164 Bibliographic essay by Nevett 2010
Important collections on houses and domestic space include Westgate et al
Ault and Nevett 2005; Laurence and Wallace-Hadrill 1997
The most extensively studied houses and households in the ancient world have been those of Pompeii

note: The most complete recent surveys on bathing with full bibliographies are Yegül 2010 and Fagan 1999.
title: On ‘Greek’ athletics in the Roman world see Newby 2005 and König 2005. On the roles of sex and sexuality in sport see Scanlon 2002. For the participation of women and girls in Greek athletics see Scanlon 1984; 1988
The substantial literature on Roman bath buildings often neglects bathing practice; Delaine and Johnston 1999 is a notable exception
